server

Class Job

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.Job
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Job
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A Job describes an action, or a 'job', that needs to be done by a client. Currently, there are only 'render' jobs--jobs that are created by a server to tell a client to render something. However, there is support for other types as well, namely 'compile' jobs that would tell a client to compile lots of images together into a video. The job can also store the product of a 'render' job, which can be returned to the server that assigned the job.
    Author:
    Calvin
    See Also:
